item.description: Processing used as a tool for exploring the intersection of the physical and virtual in MAS968, a course in computational media design taught by John Maeda, Ben Fry, and Tom White at the MIT Media Laboratory.
Processing is presented at Sonic Acts in Amsterdam.
Over the course of two evenings, ambitious students at the Interaction Design Institute Ivrea took part in an exploratory Processing workshop.

Processing workshop at Hyperwerk in Basel, Switzerland. Fifteen students participated in a one week workshop taught by Casey Reas. Hundreds of programs were written and the spirit of Jean Tinguely was in the air. Workshop images
Processing is used as a part of Golan Levin's Audiovisual Systems Course (AVES) at the Parsons School of Design in New York.
Processing was presented during the Formalisation and Creativity session of Numer02 at the Center Pompidou in Paris. Transcript of presentation
Tweny-six students from ENSCI, ENCAD, and a few members of Hyptique participated in this two day Parisian workshop taught by Casey Reas, Ben Fry, and Peter Cho. Workshop images
Processing and posters exploring genomic cartography created in Processing were presented as an exhibit at the DIS2002 conference in London.
Processing featured at Neural.it
Processing is used as a part of Zach Lieberman's Java course at the Parsons School of Design in New York.
Processing is used as a part of Casey Reas' Points and Pixels course at Interaction Ivrea.
Processing is featured in issue 64 of De:Bug, the Zeitung fuer elektronische Lebensaspekte.

Processing in the Netherlands. A one day workshop in the Hague at the Royal Conservatory's Image and Sound program, a lecture in the University of Leiden's Media Technology program, and an informal presentation in Erik van Blokland's class at the Royal Academy for Fine & Applied Arts.
An intimate Processing presentation in Helsinki at the space of the artist group Amfibio.
Processing in London. Processing presentation at the Bartlett School of Architecture.

Processing in Switzerland. A two week workshop at HyperWerk FHBB. In the first week, students executed a series of short technical exercises and in the second week they developed a longer exercise in the spirit of the DoubleCell project. On 10 January, Processing was presented in a lecture at the Bern HGKK.
Processing in Berlin. Two workshops for the Transmediale.03 on 3,4 February. Processing and its larger context presented at Automaten at 20:00 on 4 February.
Processing in New York. A one day workshop at New York University's Interactive Telecommunication Program.

Processing in Oslo. A one day workshop with the Interaction Design program at the Oslo School of Architecture. Processing is used as a platform for discussing critical issues regarding visual aspects of responsive software.
Processing in Manila. A presentation at the Ateneo IT Forum, a conference and exhibition in the Philippines.
Processing in London. A presentation at Goldsmiths College, Central St. Martins, IDEO, and for the program "The Aesthetics of Code" at 19:00 on 12 March at the Design Council.
Processing in Colombia. A one day workshop in Bogotá at the School of Art, Universidad de Los Andes.
Processing is selected for three presentation at Siggraph 2003 in San Diego: Sketches and Applications, Web Presentation, and Web Expo.
Processing in Brussels. A three day workshop and presentation at iMAL (Interactive Media Art Laboratory).

Processing in Colombia. Lectures and workshops by Hernando Barragán at the Pontificia Universidad Javeriana, Bogotá. "La programación en medios electrónicos" lecture at 2nd International Workshop Genetic Architectures. Presentation at 3rd International Workshop Contruir sobre lo construido. A one day workshop at the School of Architecture.
Processing in Barcelona. Software written in Processing was presented by Manny Tan and James Patterson at the OFFF (Online Flash Film Festival) in Barcelona.
Processing in Manila. A five week Computational Media Design workshop at Ateneo de Manila University.
Processing in Los Angeles. "Programming Media" lecture by Casey Reas at 18:00 in the UCLA Design | Media Arts department.
Processing in Cologne. A one day workshop at the Academy of Media Arts (Kunsthochschule für Medien Köln).
Processing in Nagoya. Students of Hironobu Fujiyoshi have completed their course in graphics for mobile communications and posted the work online.
Processing in London. Presentations at the Architectural Association Design Research Laboratory (AADRL) and the Royal College of Art's Interaction Design program.
Interaction Ivrea end-of-year exhibition. A two day event featuring design research results and thesis projects from the first graduating class of Interaction Ivrea.
Processing in Seoul. Four day xD_5 Workshop at Hong-Ik University and a seminar at Artcenter Nabi.
Processing at Siggraph 2003 in San Diego. Presentations in the programs Sketches & Applications, Web Graphics, and Web Expo.
Processing is featured on page 61 of the September 2003 edition of Wired Magazine.
Processing in Vienna. Many Processing applications are featured in the exhibition Abstraction Now at the Künstlerhaus Wein. Contributions from Lia, Manny Tan, REAS, Marius Watz, and Glen Murphy.

Processing at Ars Electronica. Processing included in the Electrolobby and presented in the Symposium. A group of developers including Amit Pitaru, Ed Burton, Schoenerwissen, Zach Lieberman, Marius Watz, Lia, Juha Huuskonen, Ben Fry, and Casey Reas spent the week writing software and promoting the project.
Processing is featured in the Sept/Oct edition of Print magazine.
Processing in Hebrew. Heidi Cropp and Ariel Malka release http://www.processing.co.il.
Processing in Berlin. A presentation at the extraordinary Bootlab sponsored by the Transmediale and the Office for Computational Design.
Processing in Los Angeles. Presentation for Perry Hoberman's Experiments in Interactivity course at the University of Southern California (USC).
Processing in Cambridge. Ben visits Stephen Ervin's Programming in Java class at the Harvard Design School (GSD).
Processing in India. Two day workshop organized by Rajesh Dahiya at the National Institute of Design in Ahmedabad.
Processing in New Haven. Ben visits Simon Greenwold's Model Based Design studio at the Yale School of Architecture.
Processing in Bremen. Workshop by Boris Muller and Hilla Neske at the Profile Intermedia 6 conference in Germany.
Processing in Italy. Casey Reas teaches the five day Programming Mobile Media Workshop at Interaction Ivrea.
Processing in Seoul. Peter Cho teaches the five day xD_6 Workshop at Hong-Ik University.
Processing in Israel. Two and a half day workshop at the Israeli Center for Digital Art in Holon, by Ariel Malka and Heidi Horowitz of Processing.co.il
Processing workshop in Basel. The third annual January Hyperwerk workshop. Taught by Marius Watz.
We're feeling lucky. Typing "Processing" into Google and clicking the "I'm Feeling Lucky" button will now take you here!
Presentations for the classes of George Legrady and Marcos Novak in the Media Arts and Technology (MAT) program at University of California Santa Barbara.

SIGGRAPH Manila is the visit of ACM SIGGRAPH's senior delegates exploring ideas on computer graphics and interactive techniques together with the Filipino design community. Martin Gomez will present Processing
Processing in Los Angeles. A five session Processing workshop for the USC's Interactive Media Division.
Processing lecture at San Francisco Art Institute and presentation for Krister Olsson's course. We also had the pleasure of meeting Joshua Kit Clayton of Cycling'74, author of Jitter.
Cinema Redux featured in the Guardian newspaper.
Processing presentation for Peter Lunenfeld's Design Dialogues course at Art Center College of Design, in Pasedena California.
Processing workshop at University of Huddersfield, UK.
Screenshots from various Processing work featured in an interview with Brendan Dawes in MacUser.
Processing in Istanbul. Reed Kram teaches at workshop at Istanbul Bilgi University's VCD department.
Processing in Toronto. Session at Flash in the Can, entitled Interactive Design and the Outside World featuring various Processing projects.
Processing Lecture and workshop at PixelRaiders 2 Conference at Sheffield Hallam University, UK.
Processing in Turku, Finland. Juha Huuskonen gives a workshop at the Turku Arts Academy Digital Arts program.
Processing in Toronto. Flux re:creation featuring Brendan Dawes' work with Processing.
Processing in Stockholm. Juha Huuskonen gives a workshop at the Royal University College of Fine Arts.
Processing in Latvia. Marius Watz presents Processing at the RAM5, Open Source Media Architecture event in Riga.
Processing in Slovenia. Marius Watz gives the workshop "Processing 101 - a tool for computational design" during the Magdalena festival in Maribor.
Processing at Sonar, Barcelona. A selection of Processing work, curated by José Luis de Vicente will be presented at Barcelona's Museum of Contemporary Arts (MACBA).
ICC NewSchool 9 Reactive/Creative in Tokyo is featuring a Processing workshop by Tetsu Kondo and Amit Pitaru.
Processing is presented at the Los Angeles Art and Technology Hackers Club at C-Level.
Processing is presented during the Visualization Session of the Web Graphics session at Siggraph 2004.
Who owns our (software) culture? A panel at ISEA 2004 with Miller Puckette, creator of MAX and PD, and Casey Reas, co-founder of Processing. Moderated by Juha Huuskonen.
Processing is presented at the Dorkbot City Camp in Aarhus Denmark.
Processing is featured on the Danish radio program Harddisken. Interview by Thomas Birch and Thomas Markussen.
Processing is featured at Interact1 in London.
Processing in Milan. Audio seminar by Raffaele de Tintis at Domus Academy.
Processing at Fabrica. A three day Processing workshop on computer vision by Golan Levin at Fabrica in Treviso, Italy. Thank you Andy!
Processing in Hong Kong. Workshop by Casey Reas at the City University of Hong Kong in association with the Microwave International Media Art Festival. Thank you Fion!
Processing in Milan. Audio seminar by Raffaele de Tintis at Reload.
Processing in Minneapolis. Processing lecture and workshop at MCAD (Minneapolis College of Art + Design) by Casey Reas and Ben Fry. Thank you Piotr and Santiago!
Processing wins the 2005 Tokyo TDC Interactive Design Prize.
Ben Fry and Casey Reas present Processing for the Tokyo TDC.
Ben Fry, Casey Reas, Robert Hodgin, Jared Tarbell present at FITC, Toronto.
Processing presention at the Machine Project in Echo Park, Los Angeles. Thanks Mark!
Processing in San Diego. Presentation for Lev Manovich's Current Issues in Digital Art course at the University of California San Diego.
OFFF in Barcelona features presentations by Amit Pitaru, Jared Tarbell, and Ed Burton. More info
Sonar 2005 in Barcelona! Processing presentation in Sonarama, Processing live visuals for 2 Many DJs, Tree installation by Texone, and more...
Making Things Move workshop by Zachary Lieberman at the MediaLabMadrid. Taught with Processing. More info
Real Time Everything symposium at Watershed Media Centre, Bristol. Processing presented by Yasser Rashid. More info

John Maeda has organized the Digital Information Design Camp for Summer 2005. Instructors include Ben Fry, Golan Levin, Peter Cho, Martin Wattenberg, Lisa Strausfeld, and Ellen Lupton. Application forms are available online.
UCL Adaptive Architecture and Computation Open Day. Processing works on display at Bartlett's Adaptive Architecture Lab. More info
Generator.x conference at Atelier Nord, Oslo. Organized by Marius Watz, who states, "If you ever wanted an excuse to visit Norway, this might be the time..." More info
